title: Understanding the Problem
text: One use for the derivative is to analyze motion along a line. Let s(t) be a function giving the position of an object at time $$t$$. The velocity of the object at time $$t$$ is given by v(t) $$=$$ s'(t), the derivative of s(t). Solve for s'(t).
speech: One use for the derivative is to analyze motion along a line. Let s(t) be a function giving the position of an object at time , t . The velocity of the object at time  t  is given by v(t) , is equal to  s'(t), the derivative of s(t). Solve for s'(t).
pacedSpeech: One use for the derivative is to analyze motion along a line. Let s(t) be a function giving the position of an object at time  , t
. The velocity of the object at time   t
is given by v(t)  , is equal to
s'(t), the derivative of s(t). Solve for s'(t).

title: Taking the Derivative of s(t)
speech:
v(t)  is equal to  s'(t)
s(t)  is equal to   2 t cubed,  -  15 t squared,  +  36 t  -  10 
s'(t)  is equal to   3 times 2, t raised to the 3 minus 1 power  -  2 times 15, t raised to the 2 minus 1 power  +  36 
s'(t)  is equal to   6 t squared,  -  30 t  +  36
pacedSpeech: 3 times 2, t raised to the 3 minus 1 power
-   2 times 15, t raised to the 2 minus 1 power
